summary: This document is a set of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, NY, for July 10, 2019. It details routine prison operations, counts, and inmate movements, with the most notable entry being that inmate Jeffrey Epstein was on and then removed from psychological observation with an inmate companion on that day.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Listed as inmate #76318-054. The log notes he was on psychological observation with an inmate companion and was removed from that status at 12:15 PM.

connections.description: The log states Epstein was on psychological observation 'w/inmate companion', indicating he was paired with another inmate for monitoring purposes.
Both inmates were escorted together from unit IN to ZA for fighting at 6:23 PM.

events.title: Epstein on Psychological Observation
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was listed as being on psychological observation with an inmate companion at the start of the day shift.

events.title: Epstein Removed from Psychological Observation
events.description: At 12:15 PM, inmate Jeffrey Epstein was removed from psychological observation status.

events.title: Inmate Fight and Administrative Detention
events.description: Inmates Figueroa and Maquilon were escorted from their unit to ZA for fighting at 6:23 PM and later placed in Administrative Detention.

events.title: Routine Prison Operations and Counts
events.description: The log details standard prison operations for July 10, 2019, including multiple institutional counts, equipment checks, inmate transfers, and releases.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
USP Canaan (referenced as origin for an incoming inmate bus)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) was on psychological observation with an inmate companion at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on July 10, 2019.
Epstein was removed from psychological observation at 12:15 PM on July 10, 2019.
The prison log shows routine operations, including counts, inmate transfers, and a fight between two other inmates.
The document is a standard administrative log, not an investigative report, focusing on daily prison management.
The fire alarm and sprinkler system were noted as non-operational during the morning watch but operational later in the day.
